Acrid.description: Acrid is a melee-range hybrid who uses powerful poisons to melt tanky enemies.

stats.Health Regen:
3.75/s (+0.75 per level)
 2.5/s (+0.5 per level)
 1.5/s (+0.3 per level)

Acrid.name: Acrid

skills.name: Poison
skills.Description:
Poisonous
 attacks apply a powerful damage-over-time.
skills.Notes:
Poison ticks 3 times per second for 10 seconds (plus 1 extra tick when it expires).
Poison deals 1% of the victim's maximum health per second or 100% base damage per second (whichever is greater). Poison damage is capped at 5000% base damage per second.
Poison damage is affected by Armor and has the nonlethal tag.

skills.name: Blight
skills.Description: Attacks that apply Poison apply stacking Blight instead, dealing 60% damage per second.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via the Acrid: Easy Prey Challenge. (As Acrid, land the killing blow on 50 total enemies that have 1 hit point left.)
Blight ticks 3 times per second for 5 seconds (plus 1 extra tick when it expires).
Blight deals 20% base damage per tick, for 60% damage per second. Each stack of Blight increases the damage of each tick rather than adding more ticks.

skills.name: Vicious Wounds
skills.Description:
Maul an enemy for 200% damage. Every 3rd hit is 
Regenerative
 and deals 400% damage.

skills.name: Neurotoxin
skills.Description:
Poisonous
. Spit toxic bile for 240% damage.
skills.Notes:
Agile
. Can be used during Vicious Wounds without canceling it.

skills.name: Ravenous Bite
skills.Description:
Poisonous
. 
Slayer
. 
Regenerative
. Bite an enemy for 320% damage.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via the Acrid: Bad Medicine Challenge. (As Acrid, land the final blow on a Scavenger.)
For every 1% of health the enemy is missing, the damage multiplier is increased by 2%.

skills.name: Caustic Leap
skills.Description:
Poisonous
. 
Stunning
. Leap in the air, dealing 320% damage. Leave acid that deals 25% damage.
skills.Notes:
Has 2 base charges.
The acid pool ticks 10 times per second, but is only able to damage the same target twice per second. It lasts for 10 seconds, giving it a total of 500% damage per target over its lifetime.

skills.name: Frenzied Leap
skills.Description:
Stunning
. Leap in the air, dealing 550% damage. Reduce the cooldown by 2s for every enemy hit.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via the Acrid: Pandemic Challenge. (As Acrid, inflict Poison 1000 total times.)
Has 2 base charges.

skills.name: Epidemic
skills.Description:
Poisonous
. Release a deadly disease that deals 100% damage. The disease spreads to up to 20 targets.
skills.Notes:
Agile
.
When Epidemic hits anything (enemy or geometry), it spreads to up to 2 nearby Monsters, dealing 100% base damage and poisoning them. This process repeats up to 20 times, or until there are no enemies nearby that have not yet been affected by Epidemic.

Artificer.description: The Artificer is a high burst damage survivor who excels in fighting large groups and bosses alike.

stats.Health Regen:
1.5/s (+0.3 per level)
 1/s (+0.2 per level)
 0.6/s (+0.12 per level)

Artificer.name: Artificer

skills.name: ENV Suit
skills.Description: Holding the Jump key causes the Artificer to hover in the air.
skills.Notes: This can also be changed to a toggle in the settings.

skills.name: Flame Bolt
skills.Description:
Ignite
. Fire a bolt for 280% damage. Hold up to 4.
skills.Notes:
Ignites
 enemies, dealing 50% extra total damage over time.
Explodes on contact in a 2m radius.
Explosion damage seems to have no falloff.
As of Seekers of the Storm, this skill's cooldown is reduced by attack speed with the following formula: 1.3/Attack Speed, up to the minimum 0.5s cooldown.

skills.name: Plasma Bolt
skills.Description: Fire a bolt for 280% damage that explodes in a small area. Hold up to 4.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via the Artificer: Massacre Challenge. (As Artificer, perform a multikill of 20 enemies.)
Explodes on contact in a 6m radius.
As of Seekers of the Storm, this skill's cooldown is reduced by attack speed with the following formula: 1.3/Attack Speed, up to the minimum 0.5s cooldown.

skills.name: Charged Nano-Bomb
skills.Description:
Stunning
. Charge up a exploding nano-bomb that deals 400%-2000% damage.
skills.Notes:
The player can sprint while charging the Nano-Bomb, but beginning to charge it will cancel sprinting. They will need to start charging and then sprint, and repeat this for each attack.
The attack charges a bit during its initial animation, causing the minimum damage to be 600% (increased with attack speed).
Takes 2s to fully charge with base attack speed.
The orb fires bolts at nearby enemies as it travels, dealing 1/10th of its damage per bolt (up to 200% per bolt with a full charge).
Bolts fire once every 0.125s, but can only hit the same enemy once every 1s.
Explodes on contact in a 14m radius.
Explosion damage seems to have linear falloff.
The orb's trajectory is affected by gravity and arcs downwards over long distances.

skills.name: Cast Nano-Spear
skills.Description:
Freezing
. Charge up a piercing nano-spear that deals 400%-1200% damage.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via the Artificer: Chunked! Challenge. (As Artificer, fully defeat the teleporter boss in a one-second burst of damage.)
The player can sprint while charging the Nano-Spear, but beginning to charge it will cancel sprinting. They will need to start charging and then sprint, and repeat this for each attack.
Cannot freeze bosses, except the 
 final boss
.
Enemies will burn even while frozen, and burning enemies can be frozen without being extinguished.

skills.name: Snapfreeze
skills.Description:
Freezing
. Create a barrier that hurts enemies for 100% damage.
skills.Notes:
Enemies afflicted by Freezing are frozen in place, and are instantly killed when they drop below 30% health.
Freezing does not contribute to 
 Death Mark
.
Cannot freeze bosses, except the 
 final boss
.
Sprinting while aiming Snapfreeze will immediately cast it, cancelling the startup animation.
Enemies will burn even while frozen, and burning enemies can be frozen without being extinguished.
The pillars' hitboxes are about 2.5m across and 5m tall.

skills.name: Flamethrower
skills.Description:
Ignite
. Burn all enemies in front of you for 2000% damage.
skills.Notes:
The fire beam pierces through enemies with a maximum reach of 21m.
Correction: The in-game description of 2000% damage is incorrect. Flamethrower deals damage 22 times at base attack speed, each hit dealing roughly 95% damage, with approximately half of those hits 
 igniting
 enemies. This means Flamethrower deals 2095% raw damage and about 25% extra total damage over time.
The chance to ignite enemies is affected by Luck, so changes in luck will affect the amount of damage over time inflicted.
Flamethrower deals damage over 3 seconds after a 0.6 second startup animation. Increased attack speed increases the number of damage ticks and decreases the windup period.
Using another skill or sprinting will immediately end Flamethrower.
The skill does not begin cooling down until the attack ends.
Critical chance is rolled when using the skill. If the chance succeeds, all hits will deal critical damage.

skills.name: Ion Surge
skills.Description:
Stunning
. Burst into the sky, dealing 800% damage.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via the Artificer: Orbital Bombardment Challenge. (As Artificer, kill 15 enemies before touching the ground.)
Agile
.
Launch velocity is increased with additional movement speed.
Can be used while airborne, allowing the player to fly perpetually.
Explosion damage seems to have no falloff.

Bandit.description: The Bandit is a high-skill combo character that can dish out devastating backstabs while weaving in and out of stealth.

stats.Health Regen:
1.5/s (+0.3 per level)
 1/s (+0.2 per level)
 0.6/s (+0.12 per level)

Bandit.name: Bandit

skills.name: Backstab
skills.Description: All attacks from behind are Critical Strikes.
skills.Notes:
"Behind" a target is defined as anywhere in the 180-degree hemisphere behind it.
The direction from Bandit to the target is used to determine the attack angle. As a result, an enemy facing Bandit but hit from an explosion from behind will not be a backstab critical hit (although it may critically hit for other reasons).
Only lateral direction is considered; how much a target may be looking upwards or downwards at the time is irrelevant.

skills.name: Burst
skills.Description: Fire a shotgun burst for 5x100% damage. Can hold up to 4 shells.
skills.Notes:
After firing, there is a short delay of 0.25 seconds before reloading begins.
Shells reload one at a time, taking 1.2 seconds to reload all 4 shots. Reload speed scales with attack speed.
Cannot reload while performing other attacks, but may be reloaded while invisible.

skills.name: Blast
skills.Description: Fire a rifle blast for 330% damage. Can hold up to 4 bullets.
skills.Notes: Unlocked via the Bandit: Classic Man Challenge. (As Bandit, successfully use 'Lights Out' to reset your cooldowns 15 times in a row.)

skills.name: Serrated Dagger
skills.Description:
Lunge and slash for 360% damage. Critical Strikes also cause 
hemorrhaging
.
skills.Notes:
Agile
.

skills.name: Serrated Shiv
skills.Description:
Throw a hidden blade for 240% damage. Critical Strikes also cause 
hemorrhaging
.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via the Bandit: Sadist Challenge. (As Bandit, kill a monster with 20 stacks of Hemorrhage.)
Agile
.

skills.name: Smoke Bomb
skills.Description:
Stunning
. Deal 200% damage, become invisible, then deal 200% damage again.
skills.Notes:
Agile
.
Applies upward momentum to Bandit at the start and end of the ability's duration when activated in the air.
Provides a small speed boost for the duration of the ability.
Using any skill during the ability will instantly make Bandit exit invisibility, triggering the second hit as normal. Activating an equipment will not.
Using Smoke Bomb again while still invisible will cause Bandit to end the first Smoke Bomb's effects, momentarily becoming visible, before starting the effects of the second as normal.

skills.name: Lights Out
skills.Description:
Slayer
. Fire a revolver shot for 600% damage. Kills reset all your cooldowns.
skills.Notes:
Unlike 
Bandolier
, landing a kill with Lights Out will replenish all charges of Bandit's skills, not just a single charge.
This also includes Bandit's primary weapon.

skills.name: Desperado
skills.Description:
Slayer
. Fire a revolver shot for 600% damage. Kills grant stacking tokens for 10% more Desperado damage.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via the Bandit: B&E Challenge. (As Bandit, kill the final boss with 'Lights Out'.)
Landing a kill with Desperado gives Bandit one stack of the 
 Bandit Skull
 buff.
Since kills are tracked with a buff, all bonus damage is lost upon advancing to the next stage or by being revived with 
Dio's Best Friend
 or 
Pluripotent Larva
.
Each stack of the buff increases Desperado's total damage by 10%, so each provides a 60% base damage boost.

CHEF.description: A survivor of high class, CHEF specializes in only the most exquisite meals and combos. As a culinary master, CHEF uses a variety of practiced skills in tandem for additional benefits.

stats.Health Regen:
1.5/s (+0.3 per level)
 1/s (+0.2 per level)
 0.6/s (+0.12 per level)

CHEF.name: CHEF

skills.name: CHEF's Kiss
skills.Description: Killing enemies with 2 or more skills cooks them up and drops a healing food item.
skills.Notes:
Each skill-buff (
 CookingChopped
, 
 CookingOiled
, 
 CookingRoasted
, 
 CookingRolled
, 
 CookingFlambe
) adds:
+2 flat healing
+4% fractional healing
+75% pickup scale (additive)
It will be capped at 4 stacks (8 flat healing, 16% fractional healing, and 300% pickup size). 5 stacks are unable to occur alone due to 
 CookingOiled
 being consumed with 
 Sear
 to make 
 CookingFlambe
Despite the description, it's a healing pickup similar to 
Monster Tooth
, not an item.

skills.name: Dice
skills.Description: Throw a piercing cleaver at enemies for 200% damage. Holding the attack doubles recall damage
skills.Notes:
Boost
 Boosting Dice throws many damaging cleavers in all directions. Use again to recall all cleavers.
Applies 
 CookingChopped
 to hit enemies for 100 seconds.
Cleavers travel at 145 m/s.
Holds 3 stocks, and stocks recharge when CHEF's knives come back to him

skills.name: Boosted Dice
skills.Description: Throws cleavers in all directions, dealing 400% damage.
skills.Notes:
Applies 
 CookingChopped
 to hit enemies for 100 seconds.
Boosted cleavers travel at 50m/s while non-boosted cleavers travel at 145 m/s.
Thrown cleavers automatically return, but can be returned earlier by using your primary skill.
Skill can only be used once per Boost, despite stocks.

skills.name: Sear
skills.Description:
Ignite
. Scorch nearby enemies for 600% damage.
skills.Notes:
Ignite
Boost
 Boosting Sear scorches nearby enemies and fires three fireballs dealing 700% damage.
CHEF gains 
 CookingSearing
 while firing, and applies 
 CookingRoasted
 to hit enemies for 100 seconds.
Duration
Entry: 1 second / attackSpeed
Flamethrower Duration: 1.3s + Exit Duration
Exit: 1 second / attackSpeed
If an enemy has 
 CookingOiled
 and CHEF has 
 CookingSearing
, 
 CookingOiled
 will get replaced with 
 CookingFlambe
If an enemy has 
 CookingFlambe
 and has taken damage from 
 Sear
, it will apply 3 stacks of 
 Stronger Burn
, but will not upgrade existing burn stacks unlike 
Ignition Tank
.

skills.name: Boosted Sear
skills.Description:
Ignite
. Scorch nearby enemies and fire three fireballs dealing 700% damage. Flaming oil blobs leave ignited oil pools on impact.
skills.Notes:
Ignite
CHEF gains 
 CookingSearing
 while firing, and applies 
 CookingRoasted
 to hit enemies for 100 seconds.
Unlisted: Boosted Sear deals 50% more damage per tick.
Correction: The skill description has been updated to reflect this.
CHEF fires the fireballs first before firing Sear.
Sear Duration
Entry: 1 second / attackSpeed
Flamethrower Duration: 1.3s + Exit Duration
Exit: 1 second / attackSpeed
If an enemy has 
 CookingOiled
 and CHEF has 
 CookingSearing
, 
 CookingOiled
 will get replaced with 
 CookingFlambe
If an enemy has 
 CookingFlambe
 and has taken damage from 
 Sear
, it will apply 3 stacks of 
 Stronger Burn
, but will not upgrade existing burn stacks unlike 
Ignition Tank
.

skills.name: Ice Box
skills.Description:
Frost
. Launch ice cubes for 3x150% damage.
skills.Notes:
unlocked by completing the challenge "CHEF: It's getting hot in here"
Ice Box is CHEF's alternate secondary. Ice box shoots 3 ice cubes, doing 3x150% damage on hit and applying 1 stack of frost per cube hit. Stacking an enemy with 6 stacks of "Frost" will freeze them, very similar to Artificer's abilities.

skills.name: Boosted Ice Box
skills.Description:
Freezing
. Launches 1 large ice cube for 1500% damage.

skills.name: Roll
skills.Description:
Stunning
. Charge the rolling pin to speed forward, dealing 300%-600% damage.
skills.Notes:
Stunning
Boost
 Boosting Roll applies bleed per second dealing 20% damage to all nearby enemies.
CHEF gains 
 CookingRolling
 while rolling, and applies 
 CookingRolled
 to hit enemies for 100 seconds.
Roll has different thresholds rather than a linear scale for charge damage, knockback force, speed, and duration. See CHEF#Roll Thresholds for more information.
Charge time scales with attack speed
While charging, your movement speed is set to 10%
CHEF is unable to attack during this skill

skills.name: Boosted Roll
skills.Description:
Bleeding
. Speed forward while spinning cutlery to deal an additional 200% damage to all nearby enemies.
skills.Notes:
Stunning
CHEF gains 
 CookingRolling
 while rolling, and applies 
 CookingRolled
 to hit enemies for 100 seconds.
Roll has different thresholds rather than a linear scale for charge damage, knockback force, speed, and duration. See CHEF#Roll Thresholds for more information.
Charge time scales with attack speed
While charging, your movement speed is set to 10%
CHEF is unable to attack during this skill

skills.name: Oil Spill
skills.Description: Twirl upwards then slam down, exploding with oil for 200% damage. Launch again by reactivating this ability before landing, up to 4 total.
skills.Notes: Oil Spill is CHEF's alternate utility ability. It is unlocked by completing the challenge "CHEF: You've always been crazy" which requires the player to hit 5 airborne enemies with 1 use of Roll. This can be done easily with primordial cube. Oil spill launches the player in the air, and bounces them on the ground up to 4 times. Using this ability again just before hitting the ground will trigger 2 oil balls to fall from him, which can be ignited or frozen, depending on his secondary.

skills.name: Glaze
skills.Description: Fire globs of oil in quick succession, dealing 7x200 damage, Slowing, and Weakening enemies.
skills.Notes:
Weak
Applies 
 CookingOiled
 to hit enemies for 100 seconds.
Projectiles have a lifetime of 7 seconds and travel at 60m/s and fall 20% slower.

skills.name: Yes, CHEF!
skills.Description: Emit a blast attack dealing 400% damage, inflicting Ignite or Frost. Boosts the next Skill used.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via the CHEF: Barbecued Bison Recipe Complete
Applies the 
 Boosted
 status buff.
One time use skill.
Boosts CHEF's regular abilities to make them stronger and changes properties of the attacks.
Creates a small blast attack with a radius of 10 that deals 100% damage.
Also spawns a small damage-over-time zone on CHEF that deals 10% damage every second with a proc coefficient of 0.33 that applies 
 Burn
.
Boosted skills will appear over any Heresy skills (
Visions of Heresy
, 
Hooks of Heresy
, 
Strides of Heresy
).
Activating 
 Roll
 after using a boosted 
 Dice
 or 
 Sear
 will allow you to use Roll before switching back to 
 Shadowfade

Captain.description: The Captain is a unique survivor that can control the battlefield with utility and damage - with help from the UES Safe Travels.

stats.Health Regen:
1.5/s (+0.3 per level)
 1/s (+0.2 per level)
 0.6/s (+0.12 per level)

Captain.name: Captain

skills.name: Defensive Microbots
skills.Description: Passively gain Microbots that shoot down nearby enemy projectiles. Drones are also given Microbots.
skills.Notes:
Grants a free copy of the 
Defensive Microbots
 legendary item, and appears on the item bar accordingly. See the item page for details about the item itself.
Captain will permanently lose his Defensive Microbots if they are discarded by a Mili-Tech Printer, Scrapper, Shrine of Order, or Egocentrism.
Newly allied drones and turrets will be given Defensive Microbots regardless of whether Captain has discarded his own.
If the player spawns as Captain while the 
 Artifact of Metamorphosis
 active, the Defensive Microbots will persist for the rest of the run.

skills.name: Vulcan Shotgun
skills.Description: Fire a blast of pellets that deal 8x120% damage. Charging the attack narrows the spread.
skills.Notes:
Can sprint while charging (start charging and then sprint, needs to be repeated for every attack).
Time between shots is 1 second at base attack speed.
Charge time is 1.2 seconds at base attack speed.
The pellets suffer from default projectile falloff.
Critical strikes are rolled per attack, not per pellet, so if the attack is a critical strike, all 8 pellets will critically strike at once.
Deals considerable knockback to lighter enemies; fully-charged shots can launch enemies such as 
 Lesser Wisps
 great distances.

skills.name: Power Tazer
skills.Description:
Shocking
. Fire a fast tazer that deals 100% damage. Travels farther if bounced.
skills.Notes:
Guaranteed to shock non-boss enemies hit.
Produces a 2m area of effect.
Shock wears off after 5 seconds if not broken by damage.
Shock does not contribute to the 
Death Mark
.

skills.name: Orbital Probe
skills.Description:
Stunning
. Request up to 3 Orbital Probes from the UES Safe Travels. Each probe deals 1000% damage.
skills.Notes:
Has three 'charges' when activated, and puts the player into a targeting mode similar to 
 Engineer's Thermal Harpoons
. Cooldown begins once all charges are spent.
There are a few seconds of delay before the probes land and deal damage. Adjust for enemy movement accordingly. This delay is unaffected by attack speed.
The targeting mode can be cancelled by sprinting, but cancelling the strike after calling the probes will still incur the full cooldown length.

skills.name: OGM-72 'DIABLO' Strike
skills.Description:
Stunning
. Request a kinetic strike from the UES Safe Travels. After 20 seconds, it deals 40,000% damage to ALL characters.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via the Captain: Smushed Challenge. (As Captain, kill the final boss using a Supply Beacon)
The strike suffers from sweet spot falloff.
The 20 second delay before the strike lands and deals damage is unaffected by attack speed.
Correction: The damage dealt by friendly-fire attacks is halved, so the strike deals 20,000% damage to Captain, not 40,000%.

skills.name: Orbital Supply Beacon
skills.Description: Request a permanent Supply Beacon. Can only be requested twice per stage.
skills.Notes:
Activating this skill puts the player into a targeting mode which displays where the beacon will land. The primary skill button calls in the first beacon, and the secondary skill button calls in the second beacon. Once both have been called in, the skill icon will turn into a red NO ENTRY sign for the rest of the stage.
Beacons take a few moments to arrive and fully deploy before their effect activates.
The beacons' functions are selected before a run in the loadout menu. Their appearance varies by function.
If a beacon lands on an enemy, it deals 2000% damage.
Beacon targeting can be cancelled by sprinting.
Each beacon's radius of effect is about 9m, as displayed by the drop guide.
Beacons cannot get critical strikes.

skills.name: Beacon: Healing
skills.Description: Heal all nearby allies for 10% of their maximum health every second.
skills.Notes: When in the area of multiple beacons at once, the effects will stack.

skills.name: Beacon: Shocking
skills.Description: Periodically Shock all nearby enemies, immobilizing them.
skills.Notes: Fires every 3 seconds, repeatedly shocking susceptible enemies and locking them in place until attacked.

skills.name: Beacon: Resupply
skills.Description: Recharge Equipment on use.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via the Captain: Wanderlust Challenge. (As Captain, visit 10 different environments in a single run.)
The beacon can be used up to three times.

skills.name: Beacon: Hacking
skills.Description: Hack all nearby purchasables to a cost of $0 over time.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via the Captain: Worth Every Penny Challenge. (As Captain, repair and recruit a TC-280 Prototype.)
Purchasables are hacked starting with the closest. This includes the nearest segment of a Multishop Terminal or Equipment Triple Shop.
Upon hacking: Chests will be opened, Drones will be immediately bought, Shrines of Chance will be activated once and cost $0 for all remaining attempts, Altars of Gold will be automatically activated, and Shrines of the Woods will have the first level bought, with subsequent levels costing $0.
Takes a longer time to hack items that are more expensive. Large Chests take longer than Chests, and Legendary Chests take much longer.
Does not activate interactables that are locked by the Teleporter Event (but it will still reduce their cost to $0), or interactables that cost any currency other than gold, such as Lunar Coins.

Commando.description: The Commando is a jack-of-all-trades character that is reliable in all situations of the game.

stats.Health Regen:
1.5/s (+0.3 per level)
 1/s (+0.2 per level)
 0.6/s (+0.12 per level)

Commando.name: Commando

skills.name: Double Tap
skills.Description: Rapidly shoot an enemy for 100% damage.
skills.Notes:
Shoots 6 times per second at base attack speed.
The bullets suffer from default projectile falloff.

skills.name: Phase Round
skills.Description: Fire a piercing bullet for 300% damage. Deals 40% more damage every time it passes through an enemy.
skills.Notes:
Can travel through terrain.
Each progressive pierce deals 120% more base damage, as the 40% damage increase is total damage, not base damage.

skills.name: Phase Blast
skills.Description: Fire two close-range blasts that deal 8x200% damage total.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via the Commando: Rolling Thunder Challenge. (As Commando, land the killing blow on an Overloading Worm.)
The blasts suffer from buckshot falloff.

skills.name: Tactical Dive
skills.Description: Roll a short distance.
skills.Notes:
Agile
.

skills.name: Tactical Slide
skills.Description: Slide on the ground for a short distance. You can fire while sliding.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via the Commando: Godspeed Challenge. (As Commando, fully charge the first-stage teleporter before the timer hits 5 minutes.)
Agile
.
If used in the air, it adds a small amount of vertical momentum and works like a short extra jump.

skills.name: Suppressive Fire
skills.Description:
Stunning
. Fire repeatedly for 100% damage per bullet. The number of shots increases with attack speed.
skills.Notes:
Fires more shots with increased attack speed, equal to 6 times the attack speed stat (6 bullets at base attack speed).
The bullets suffer from default projectile falloff.

skills.name: Frag Grenade
skills.Description: Throw a grenade that explodes for 700% damage. Can hold up to 2.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via the Commando: Incorruptible Challenge. (As Commando, clear 20 stages in a single run without picking up any Lunar items.)
The timer for the explosion begins after the first bounce and is 1 second long.
The explosion suffers from sweet spot falloff.

Drifter.description: The Drifter is a resourceful survivor who's quick to claim every opportunity whilst gathering Junk to spend on powerful skills.

stats.Health Regen:
1.5/s (+0.3 per level)

 0.6/s (+0.12 per level)

Drifter.name: Drifter

Engineer.description: The Engineer is a unique class that requires planning and positioning to be successful.
Engineer.name: Engineer

skills.name: Bouncing Grenades
skills.Description: Charge up to 8 grenades that deal 100% damage each.
skills.Notes: Can sprint while charging (start charging and then sprint, needs to be repeated for every attack).

skills.name: Pressure Mines
skills.Description: Place a two-stage mine that deals 300% damage, or 900% damage if fully armed. Can place up to 4.
skills.Notes:
Mines take a few seconds to 'arm' to their full 900% damage potential. This is indicated by a large green circle and a shaft of light from the mine's center.
Mines do not stick to allies or enemies, but do stick to Bubble Shield.
The explosion has no damage falloff.
Mines' detection radius is 7.5m when fully armed.

skills.name: Spider Mines
skills.Description: Place a robot mine that deals 600% damage when an enemy walks nearby. Can place up to 4.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via the Engineer: 100% Calculated Challenge. (As Engineer, defeat the teleporter boss in less than 5 seconds after it spawns.)
Do not need to arm, making them a more immediate offensive option.
Deals an immediate 600% damage if thrown directly onto enemies, double that of the Pressure Mines when not fully armed.
Actively seek out enemies that enter their radius, rather than enemies needing to come close.

skills.name: Bubble Shield
skills.Description: Place an impenetrable shield that blocks all incoming damage.
skills.Notes:
Agile
.
Lasts for 15s, covering an estimated 9.75m radius.
Only one can be active at a time.
Flashes before disappearing.
Enemies can move inside the barrier, negating its effects.
Anything can fire outwards from the shield, and nothing can fire through it inwards, not even players or their allies.

skills.name: Thermal Harpoons
skills.Description: Enter target painting mode to launch heat-seeking harpoons that deal 500% damage each. Can store up to 4.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via the Engineer: Zero Sum Challenge. (As Engineer, finish charging the teleporter with zero monsters remaining on the stage.)
Pressing the utility key enters painting mode. Hold down the primary key and move the cursor over enemies to paint targets.
Up to 4 harpoons can be painted onto 1-4 targets. Each harpoon takes 0.3 seconds to lock onto an enemy.
Harpoons do not recharge while in painting mode.
Harpoons cannot be fired without a target.
Fired harpoons that no longer have a target will redirect to the nearest target. (It is possible to build up a swarm of harpoons by constantly firing at a single target when no other targets are within range.)
Painting mode can be cancelled by pressing the secondary key. Even if there were targets acquired, no charges will deplete and no harpoons will fire.
Thermal Harpoons are treated as missiles for the 
Pocket I.C.B.M.
 and will receive its effects, tripling the amount of projectiles fired per cast and increasing their damage with more stacks.

skills.name: TR12 Gauss Auto-Turret
skills.Description: Place a turret that inherits all your items. Fires a cannon for 100% damage. Can place up to 2.
skills.Notes:
Description clarification: Fires a cannon approximately 3 times per second for 70% of the turret's damage per shot for a total of 210% damage per second.
The shots suffer from default projectile falloff.
Up to 3 turrets can be placed if the Engineer has a 
Lysate Cell
. Additional stacks of the Lysate Cell do not grant additional turrets.

skills.name: TR58 Carbonizer Turret
skills.Description: Place a mobile turret that inherits all your items. Fires a laser for 200% damage per second that slows enemies. Can place up to 2.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via the Engineer: Better With Friends Challenge. (As Engineer, recruit 12 minions at one time.)
Description clarification: Fires a laser that ticks approximately 5 times per second for 40% of the turret's damage per shot for a total of 200% damage per second.
These turrets follow Engineer and stick close by him.
The laser has no damage falloff and inflicts 
 50% Slow
.
The laser has a maximum range that it abruptly stops at, which is slightly longer than the maximum range at which a turret can acquire a target to fire upon.
The maximum target range for the TR58 Carbonizer Turrets appear to be noticeably shorter than the TR12 Gauss Auto-Turrets.
Up to 3 turrets can be placed if the Engineer has a 
Lysate Cell
. Additional stacks of the Lysate Cell do not grant additional turrets.

False Son.description: The False Son is a slow but stalwart close-range warrior. With extreme health and defense, False Son can weather any storm. Use False Son's durability to stay in the fray and capitalize on his slow but deadly skills.

stats.Health Regen:
1.5/s (+0.75 per level)
 1/s (+0.5 per level)
 0.6/s (+0.3 per level)

False Son.name: False Son

skills.name: Lunar Tampering
skills.Description: Unused Lunar Spike gives +5% attack speed and +2.5 armor. Used spikes give +5% movement speed and +2.5 health regeneration.
skills.Notes:
Newly earned 
 Lunar Spikes
 begin as used.
Due to False Son starting with 4 Lunar Spikes, his base attack speed is 0.8 so that with the bonus it is as close as possible to the starting value of 1.0 of every other survivor and monster.

skills.name: Club of the Forsaken
skills.Description: Swing for 450% damage. Hold the primary and secondary skills to charge a slam for 1000% damage.
skills.Notes: Holding down the secondary skill skill replaces the Lunar Spikes with an alternative slam attack.

skills.name: Club Slam
skills.Description: Hold the primary and secondary skills to charge a slam for 1000% damage.
skills.Notes:
The attack takes 1.5 seconds to fully charge. This scales with attack speed, so for the default 0.96 attack speed the actual duration is 1.5625 seconds.
If the secondary skill is released before 80% of the attack has been charged, a simple overhead swing is executed instead for 300% damage with a 1.0 proc coefficient.
This premature attack only occurs if False Son is grounded. If he is in the air, the attack is cancelled altogether.
If the attack has been charged for at least 80% of its duration, the club will glow and a blast will be executed. This deals damage equal to baseDamage  1500%  charge + (maxHealth - (baseHealth + levelHealth  levelsMinusOne)  0.01. False Son will also only move at 75% speed while in this state.
The damage modification due to the difference of the base level max health vs actual max health is extremely minimal, since for every 100 points of health missing or added, the damage output is adjusted by 1 hit point.
The radius of the slam depends on various conditions.
If False Son is currently grounded, the blast radius is 5  (charge + 1.55).
If instead he is in the air, he dives to the ground and the blast radius will be 5  (charge + 1.25 + timeInAir  2). If False Son is in the air for less than 0.5 seconds, i.e., a normal jump, timeInAir is set to 0.
False Son gains fall damage immunity when diving, similar to 
 Acrid's
 utility skill.
Even though the skill is activated by pressing the secondary skill, the attack is considered a primary attack and as such it can proc 
Luminous Shot
.

skills.name: Lunar Spikes
skills.Description:
Lunar Ruin. 
Agile
. Throw a Lunar Spike for 200% damage. Gain more Lunar Spikes through Growth.
skills.Notes:
This inflicts 
 Lunar Ruin
 which causes enemies to take +10% more damage and have their healing reduced by 20% for each stack. Lunar Ruin lasts for 5 seconds but new stacks will refresh the duration.
This means that even with no items, False Son can constantly stack this debuff as the skill cooldown is 4 seconds (assuming the projectile does not take more than a second to reach the target).
Unlike the lightning strikes in 
 Prime Meridian
, this debuff is actually considered a Damage over Time source with 1 damage per stack and a 3-second tick period.
The tick period is reset every time a new stack is added.
In the absence of additional applications of the DoT, any accumulated stacks will tick twice. The first time the Lunar Ruin debuff will be present, which effectively increases the damage quadratically the more DoT stacks have been inflicted.
Growth enhances this skill by granting additional charges the more bonus health False Son accumulates outside of levelling up. See the Growth section for more details.

skills.name: Lunar Stakes
skills.Description: Lunar Ruin. Fire a piercing, lightning infused Lunar Stake for 300% damage. Gain more Lunar Stakes through Growth. Counts as 2 Lunar Spikes.
skills.Notes:
This inflicts 
 Lunar Ruin
 which causes enemies to take +10% more damage and have their healing reduced by 20% for each stack. Lunar Ruin lasts for 5 seconds but new stacks will refresh the duration.
This skill can apply the effect 
 Lunar Ruin
 3 times to 1 enemy, this projectile pierces, calls down a strike on everything it hits, and calls another strike were it lands, causing the debuff when it pierces an enemy, and for each strike that hits an enemy. Because of this, this can deal with large groups of enemies efficiently.
Unlike the lightning strikes in 
 Prime Meridian
, this debuff is actually considered a Damage over Time source with 1 damage per stack and a 3-second tick period.
The tick period is reset every time a new stack is added.
Lunar Stakes have a hitbox that is slightly larger than their visual model - this is mostly apparent if using them while near a Halcyon Shrine, the prongs of the Teleporter, or while in front of a low wall. Be mindful of close obstacles to avoid accidentally wasting Lunar Stakes.

skills.name: Step of the Brothers
skills.Description: Dash a short distance, generating an explosion of 200% damage for every enemy hit. Two uses.
skills.Notes:
The attack scans for enemies approximately 8m ahead every 0.1 seconds. If any enemies are detected, an explosion is triggered in a 20m radius with linear falloff.
This means the first time an enemy is detected, due to the damage falloff they will not take the full 200% damage. However, False Son briefly stops travelling when piercing through enemies, so unless he is travelling at extremely high speeds, a second scan will be performed when he's very close to his target if front of him.
The dash grants 
 Hidden Invincibility
 for its duration.

skills.name: Meridian's Will
skills.Description:
Stunning
. Teleport and explode for 150% damage and pull enemies. Triple your passive's benefits for 4s. Growth increases this duration.
skills.Notes: Having additional stacks Growth will unlock the ability to teleport farther This ability makes stacking Stone Flux Pauldrons A LOT easier, as more stacks of growth make it go farther compared to step of the brothers.of Under progress (pls hlep add info)

skills.name: Laser of the Father
skills.Description: Charge a rapidly hitting laser dealing 240%-1400% damage for 4s and refill Lunar Spikes. Increases in duration through Growth.
skills.Notes:
The attack takes 2 seconds to fully charge. This scales with attack speed, so for the default 0.96 attack speed the actual value is a little over 2 seconds.
The damage it deals depends on the duration percent charged for. However, even if released too early, there is a minimum value of 17.5% for the charge, while over 85% it is actually set to 100%.
The laser suffers from default damage falloff.
The laser has a base duration of 4 seconds, which is increased based on the number of bonus stocks of Lunar Spikes Growth grants. See the Growth section for more details.
This is not affected by the bonus stocks from 
Backup Magazine
.
Charging up the attack does not increase the duration of the attack, only its damage output per tick.
The laser fires 12 times per second, which is modified by 30% of the difference between False Son's current attack speed vs his base attack speed, which is 0.8.
With the default 4 Lunar Spikes, his attack speed is 0.96 and therefore he fires 12.048 times per second.
Items that negatively affect one's attack speed, such as 
Light Flux Pauldron
 and 
Tonic Affliction
 also have less of a negative impact due to the 30% coefficient.
Bug: The bonus firing frequency accumulates with each usage until the game is restarted. If the player uses this skill for a prolonged period of time with a high Growth value, it will eventually have a noticeable effect.
While the firing frequency is capped at 60 due to the engine running at 60 fps, this would still yield 10500% damage per second.
Both when charging and firing the laser, False Son moves at 55% speed.
One Lunar Spike stock is regained every second.
This is not increased with Growth nor does it need the laser to be actively hitting at a target.
Firing the laser will reset its cooldown, which is relevant when carrying 
Lysate Cells
.
Additionally, while normally the skill's cooldown begins when the laser ends, with this item the cooldown begins once the laser starts firing instead.
False Son's primary cancels this skill.

skills.name: Laser Burst
skills.Description: Fire a piercing laser for 1000% damage, refilling 30% Lunar Spikes. Increases in stock by Growth.
skills.Notes: For every 4 bonus Lunar Spike stocks acquired from Growth, this skill gains an additional stock. See the Growth section for more details.

Heretic.description: The Heretic is a powerful character who can only be accessed through extraordinary means.

stats.Health Regen:
-9/s (-1.8 per level)
 -6/s (-1.2 per level)
 -3.6/s (-0.72 per level)

Heretic.name: Heretic

skills.name: Nevermore
skills.Description: Squawk a solemn reply.
skills.Notes:
This skill exists in all four of the Heretic's skill slots, but is usually not seen by the player due to being overridden by the four Heresy skills that are necessary to transform into her.
Has no meaningful effect at all, emitting only a quiet squawk when used.
Can only be used if a Cleansing Pool, Shrine of Order or 
Egocentrism
 causes the Heretic to lose one of her Heresy items.

skills.name: Hungering Gaze
skills.Cooldown: 2s (+2s per stack) since the last shot was fired
skills.Description: Fire a flurry of tracking shards that detonate after a delay, dealing 120% base damage. Hold up to 12 charges (+12 per stack) that reload after 2 seconds (+2 per stack).
skills.Notes:
The initial hit deals 5% base damage.
Once the cooldown period is finished, all stacks are recharged at once.
Each shot will reset the cooldown period back to the full 2 seconds.
Changes the firing of 
 Engineer's
 turrets.
Replaces both of 
 MUL-T's
 selected primary skills. However, it does not replace the second primary while in Power Mode.
Picking up an Ammo Box from a 
Bandolier
 will grant the full capacity.
Getting a 
Purity
 will allow the player to only have a 0.5 second cooldown between shots.
Takes about 1.29 seconds to fire 12 shots, and 3.29 seconds including the cooldown.

skills.name: Slicing Maelstrom
skills.Description: Charge up a projectile that deals 875% damage per second to nearby enemies, exploding after 3 seconds to deal 700% damage and root enemies for 3 (+3 per stack) seconds. Recharges after 5 (+5 per stack) seconds.
skills.Notes:
Correction: The in-game description of 175% damage per second is incorrect. The blade maelstrom can hit up to 5 times per second, dealing 175% damage per hit for 875% damage per second total.
Charging up the projectile increases the initial launch velocity of the projectile, charging faster with increased attack speed. The projectile is automatically launched at full charge.
Once thrown, the projectile rapidly decelerates and will usually come to a halt before it explodes on its timer.
The projectile penetrates enemies and players but bounces off of terrain.
The ending explosion has a radius of 14m and applies the 
 Lunar Root
 debuff to enemies, rooting them.

skills.name: Shadowfade
skills.Description: Fade away, becoming intangible and gaining +30% movement speed. Heal for 18.2% (+18.2% per stack) of your maximum health. Lasts 3 (+3 per stack) seconds.
skills.Notes:
Correction: The in-game description of healing 25% max health is incorrect. Instead, it gives 1.3% max health per tick for 14 ticks, for a total of 18.2% max health per activation, per stack.
The player can fly during the skill's duration if activating it in midair.
The invulnerable period cannot be cancelled early.
While invulnerable, the player can still interact with things and activate their equipment, but cannot use any skills.
The player's hurtbox is removed while invulnerable, so even a 
 Void Reaver's
 implosion can be avoided.

skills.name: Ruin
skills.Description: Dealing damage adds a stack of Ruin for 10 (+10 per stack) seconds. Activating the skill detonates all Ruin stacks at unlimited range, dealing 300% damage plus 120% damage per stack of Ruin. Recharges after 8 (+8 per stack) seconds.
skills.Notes:
Multiple enemies can be affected by 
 Ruin
 simultaneously.
The chance to inflict Ruin is multiplied by the proc coefficient of the attack, but it will always last for the full 10 seconds. Damage with a proc coefficient of 0, such as 
 Bleed
, will never add any Ruin.
All stacks of Ruin are refreshed when a new stack is applied to that target.
When the skill is activated, one shot is fired at each enemy suffering from Ruin. These shots penetrate terrain, and have a Proc Coefficient of 1.0
While the skill is on cooldown, the player cannot inflict Ruin on enemies.
Minions such as Drones will not inflict Ruin.

Huntress.description: The Huntress is an extremely mobile but fragile survivor with a high damage output.

stats.Health Regen:
1.5/s (+0.3 per level)
 1/s (+0.2 per level)
 0.6/s (+0.12 per level)

Huntress.name: Huntress

skills.name: Strafe
skills.Description:
Agile
. Quickly fire a seeking arrow for 150% damage.
skills.Notes:
Fires once per 0.5 seconds at base attack speed.
Can only be used while locked onto an enemy. Huntress automatically locks onto the closest enemy to her within 60m.
When shot, the arrow homes in on its target, ignoring terrain and cover.

skills.name: Flurry
skills.Description:
Agile
. Draw back a volley of 3 seeking arrows for 3x100% damage. Critical Strikes fire 6 arrows.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via the Huntress: Finishing Touch Challenge. (As Huntress, land a killing blow with every possible hit of a single glaive.)
Fires once per 1.3s at base attack speed.
Can only be used while locked onto an enemy. Huntress automatically locks onto the closest enemy to her within 60m.
All arrows home in on a target, ignoring terrain and cover.
Critical strikes are rolled immediately before firing projectiles. If the roll fails, 3 regular arrows are fired, and if it succeeds, 6 critically-damaging arrows are fired. This means that when Flurry successfully rolls a critical strike, it deals 4 times the normal damage instead of 2 times.
While Flurry is initially weaker than Strafe, this interaction makes it stronger with high critical strike chance.

skills.name: Laser Glaive
skills.Description: Throw a seeking glaive that bounces up to 6 times for 250% damage. Damage increases by 10% per bounce.
skills.Notes:
Can only be used while locked onto an enemy. Huntress automatically locks onto the closest enemy to her within 60m.
Can travel through terrain.
The 10% damage boost is a multiplier; each bounce deals 1.1x as much damage as the previous one.
This allows Laser Glaive to activate 
Runald's Band
, 
Kjaro's Band
, and 
Singularity Band
 on the last 2 hits.
Laser Glaive deals a total of 2372% damage if it hits every bounce.

skills.name: Blink
skills.Description: Disappear and teleport forward.
skills.Notes:
Teleport a medium distance in the direction the player's camera is facing.
This includes teleporting straight up or down.
The distance traveled scales with movement speed.
Blink resets vertical momentum.

skills.name: Phase Blink
skills.Description:
Agile
. Disappear and teleport a short distance. Can store up to 3 charges.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via the Huntress: One Shot, One Kill Challenge. (As Huntress, collect and carry 12 Crowbars at once.)
Teleport a short distance only in the horizontal direction the player is facing.
Unlike Blink, the player cannot Phase Blink upwards or downwards, only horizontally.
The distance traveled scales with movement speed.
Phase Blink resets vertical momentum.

skills.name: Arrow Rain
skills.Description: Teleport into the sky. Target an area to rain arrows, slowing all enemies and dealing 330% damage per second.
skills.Notes:
Correction: The in-game description of 225% damage per second is incorrect.
Arrow Rain hits 19 times over 6 seconds, dealing 2090% damage total.
The targeted area has a radius of 7.5m, and it must be solid terrain.
As a result, Arrow Rain can struggle to hit airborne enemies, since they cannot be directly targeted.
Arrow Rain is automatically cast after 2 seconds pass in targeting mode.

skills.name: Ballista
skills.Description: Teleport backwards into the sky. Fire up to 3 energy bolts, dealing 3x900% damage.
skills.Notes: Unlocked via the Huntress: Piercing Wind Challenge. (As Huntress, start and finish either Rallypoint Delta or Scorched Acres without falling below 100% health.)

Loader.description: The Loader is a slow but powerful bruiser that can use her grappling hook to uniquely navigate the environment.

stats.Health Regen:
3.75/s (+0.75 per level)
 2.5/s (+0.5 per level)
 1.5/s (+0.3 per level)

Loader.name: Loader

skills.name: Scrap Barrier
skills.Description: The Loader is immune to fall damage. Striking enemies with the Loader's gauntlets grants a temporary barrier.
skills.Notes:
The barrier gained is 5% of the maximum amount (5% of Loader's maximum health and current shields).
Hitting multiple enemies with Knuckleboom or Thunder Gauntlet does not grant additional barrier, but hitting multiple enemies with Charged Gauntlet does.

skills.name: Knuckleboom
skills.Description: Swing at nearby enemies for 320% damage.

skills.name: Grapple Fist
skills.Description: Fire your gauntlet forward, pulling you to the target.
skills.Notes: Deals no damage.

skills.name: Spiked Fist
skills.Description:
Stunning
. Fire your gauntlet forward, dealing 320% damage. Pulls you to heavy targets. Light targets are pulled to YOU instead.
skills.Notes: Unlocked via the Loader: Swing By Challenge. (As Loader, reach and proceed through the Celestial Portal in 25 minutes or less.)

skills.name: Charged Gauntlet
skills.Description:
Heavy
. Charge up a piercing punch for 600%-2700% damage.
skills.Notes:
Beginning to charge Charged Gauntlet will stop Loader from sprinting, but the player can begin sprinting again while charging.
The punch deals an extra +30% base damage per 1m/s of Loader's current velocity.
Can hold the charge.
Charges faster with more attack speed.

skills.name: Thunder Gauntlet
skills.Description:
Heavy
. Charge up a single-target punch for 2100% damage that shocks enemies in a cone for 1000% damage.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via the Loader: Earthshatter Challenge. (As Loader, land a Charged Gauntlet hit at 300mph or higher.)
Charges considerably faster than Charged Gauntlet.
Fires automatically when fully charged.
Correction: The lightning cone deals 900% damage, not 1000%.
Like Charged Gauntlet, the punch deals an extra +30% base damage per 1m/s of Loader's current velocity.
However, the damage from the lightning cone does not receive the 
Heavy
 damage bonus.

skills.name: M551 Pylon
skills.Description: Throw a floating pylon that zaps up to 6 nearby enemies for 100% damage. Can be grappled.
skills.Notes:
It is possible to create multiple pylons with enough cooldown reduction items (e.g. 
Brainstalks
, 
Bandolier
, or stacking 
Alien Head
) or stacking 
Lysate Cell
, but only up to 3 pylons can be active at a time. If the skill is used again while there are 3 pylons active, the oldest one despawns.
The pylon is initially inactive for 1.65 seconds. After this, it zaps a total of 14 times (once every second), and it can hit up to 6 enemies per zap.
Critical strikes are rolled when the pylon spawns; if the roll succeeds, all zaps over the pylon's lifespan will be critical strikes.
Does not attack faster with bonus attack speed.

skills.name: Thunderslam
skills.Description:
Stunning
. Slam your fists down, dealing 2000% damage on impact.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via the Loader: The Thunderdome Challenge. (As Loader, kill three other Loaders in the Bulwark's Ambry.)
The blast radius is about 15m.

MUL-T.description: MUL-T is an aggressive survivor who has the tools necessary for any job!

stats.Health Regen:
1.5/s (+0.3 per level)
 1/s (+0.2 per level)
 0.6/s (+0.12 per level)

MUL-T.name: MUL-T

skills.name: Auto-Nailgun
skills.Description: Rapidly fire nails for 70% damage. Finishes with a blast of 12 nails.
skills.Notes:
Fires 12 nails per second, for 840% damage per second.
The nails suffer from default projectile falloff.
The nails fire in a moderately wide, haphazard corkscrew pattern.
After releasing the primary key, there is a 1.152 second period before more nails can be fired again.
The final blast recoils a little.

skills.name: Rebar Puncher
skills.Description: Fire a piercing rebar that deals 600% damage.
skills.Notes: The base time between shots is 1.8s, for 333% damage per second.

skills.name: Scrap Launcher
skills.Description: Fire a rocket that explodes for 360% damage. Hold up to 4.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via the MUL-T: Pest Control Challenge. (As MUL-T, defeat two Beetle Queens without leaving the teleporter zone.)
The rockets travel at 100 m/s and explode in a 7m radius.
The explosions suffer from sweet spot damage falloff.
There is a 0.3 second period after each rocket before the next can be fired, although this recovery period is shortened with increased attack speed. This means it takes a base time of 0.9 seconds to fire all 4 shots, if ignoring the delay after the final shot.
All 4 shots can be fired and reloaded every 2.4 seconds for 600% damage per second.
The cooldown begins when the first shot is fired. Subsequent shots reset the cooldown. When the cooldown ends, 4 shots are reloaded.

skills.name: Power-Saw
skills.Description: Saw nearby enemies for 1000% damage per second.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via the MUL-T: Gotcha! Challenge. (As MUL-T, land the killing blow on an Imp Overlord with the Preon Accumulator.)
Each damage tick deals 100% damage, and the attack ticks 10 times per second at base attack speed.
Hitting an enemy with the saw pulls the player towards it slightly.
Activating the saw will interrupt the player's sprinting, but they can sprint again while using it.

skills.name: Blast Canister
skills.Description:
Stunning
. Launch a canister for 220% damage. Drops stun bomblets for 5x44% damage.
skills.Notes: Holding the secondary key displays the projectiles's arc and blast radius.

skills.name: Transport Mode
skills.Description:
Heavy
. Zoom forward, gaining 200 armor and 220% movement speed. Deals 250% damage to enemies.
skills.Notes:
Grants 200 armor and up to 45% additional speed.
Transport Mode deals proportionally more damage based on bonuses to MUL-T's movement speed stat, but does not deal more damage based on MUL-T's current velocity.
Forces MUL-T to move forwards at full speed. Steering left and right is still possible, but jumping is not.
The player cannot ram a monster twice in one skill use.
Ramming a large enemy will end Transport Mode early, but it will deal 4 times as much damage and stun that enemy.
Can be used during Power Saw without cancelling it.
Cooldown does not begin until the skill ends.

skills.name: Retool
skills.Description: Passively hold TWO equipment at once. Activating 'Retool' switches the active Equipment and MUL-T's primary attack.
skills.Notes:
Swapping takes 0.4s.
As of the Anniversary Update, carrying two equipment and being able to swap them is no longer considered a passive and is now unique to Retool.

skills.name: Power Mode
skills.Description: Enter a heavy stance, equipping both your primary attacks at once. Gain 100 armor, but lose -60% movement speed.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via the MUL-T: Seventh Day Challenge. (As MUL-T, clear the Void Fields on Stage 7 or later.)
Correction: The skill actually only raises the player's slow coefficient by 50%, which results in a 1/1.5, or 66% movement speed multiplier.

Mercenary.description: The Mercenary is a high skill melee survivor that uses his many dodges to weave in and out of combat.

stats.Health Regen:
1.5/s (+0.3 per level)
 1/s (+0.2 per level)
 0.6/s (+0.12 per level)

Mercenary.name: Mercenary

skills.name: Cybernetic Enhancements
skills.Description: The Mercenary can jump twice.
skills.Notes:
The second jump's height is slightly lower than the first.
The 
Wax Quail's
 jump boost applies for both of Mercenary's base jumps.
Additional jumps granted by the 
Hopoo Feather
 follow the same front flip animation used by Mercenary's second base jump, a trait unique to this Survivor.

skills.name: Laser Sword
skills.Description:
Agile
. Slice in front for 130% damage. Every 3rd hit strikes in a greater area and 
Exposes
 enemies.
skills.Notes:
The base swing speed is 0.42s per swing, with a 0.64s recovery window after the third swing which artificially reduces the base swing speed.
Any bonus attack speed will decrease the time spent in the recovery animation, but it cannot be fully removed.
When using another skill during the third swing's animation, the recovery animation is canceled. This also causes the third swing's hitbox to remain active while using that other skill, staying front of Mercenary as the skill moves him.

skills.name: Whirlwind
skills.Description: Quickly slice horizontally twice, dealing 2x200% damage. If airborne, slice vertically instead.
skills.Notes: The animation speed is improved with attack speed, which also reduces the time taken to cast other skills.

skills.name: Rising Thunder
skills.Description: Unleash a slicing uppercut, dealing 550% damage and sending you airborne.
skills.Notes: Unlocked via the Mercenary: Demon of the Skies Challenge. (As Mercenary, don't touch the ground for 30 seconds.)

skills.name: Blinding Assault
skills.Description:
Stunning
. Dash forward, dealing 300% damage. If you hit an enemy, you can dash again, up to 3 total.
skills.Notes:
The color of the icon will change depending on how many uses the skill has before going on cooldown; Blue for three, Yellow for two, Red for one.
The animation speed and total distance traveled is improved by attack speed bonuses.
The player has 2.66 (depending on fps) seconds to use this ability again after striking an enemy (while a charge is available).
Grants invulnerability for ~0.3 seconds and a lingering ~0.3 seconds at the end of each dash, for a total of 0.6 per dash and a total of 1.8 seconds of invulnerability for all dashes combined.

skills.name: Focused Assault
skills.Description:
Stunning
. Dash forward, dealing 700% damage and 
Exposing
 enemies after 1 second.
skills.Notes: Unlocked via the Mercenary: Flash of Blades Challenge. (As Mercenary, use 20 abilities in 10 seconds.)

skills.name: Eviscerate
skills.Description: Target the nearest enemy, attacking them for 110% damage repeatedly. You cannot be hit for the duration.
skills.Notes:
Lasts for 1.3s after casting. The player is invincible during this time, and for an additional 0.6s seconds afterwards.
Damages enemies 7 times at base attack speed. The amount of hits increases with bonus attack speed, but the duration does not.
If no enemy is targeted, Mercenary simply dashes forward.

skills.name: Slicing Winds
skills.Description:
Fire a wind of blades that attack up to 3 enemies for 8x100% damage. The last hit 
Exposes
 enemies.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via the Mercenary: Ethereal Challenge. (As Mercenary, complete a Prismatic Trial without falling below 100% health.)
Deals 8x100% damage to up to 3 enemies, for a total of 3x800%, or 2400% damage (excluding the Exposed proc)
