REX.description: REX is a half robot / half plant that uses HP to cast devastating skills from a distance. The plant nor the robot could survive this planet alone  but thankfully they have each other.

stats.Health Regen:
1.5/s (+0.3 per level)
 1/s (+0.2 per level)
 0.6/s (+0.12 per level)

REX.name: REX

skills.name: Natural Toxins
skills.Description:
Certain attacks 
Weaken
 enemies hit, reducing their movement speed, armor, and damage.
skills.Notes:
Note: The in-game description of -20 armor is incorrect. It is actually -30 armor.
Lasts 3 seconds.

skills.name: DIRECTIVE: Inject
skills.Description:
Fire 3 syringes for 3x80% damage. The last syringe 
Weakens
 and heals for 60% of damage dealt.
skills.Notes:
Burst duration is 0.2 seconds and the animation duration is 0.6 seconds.
Each shot of the burst can crit independently.
The shots fire in a narrow horizontal fan, meaning that landing all 3 hits against distant targets may be difficult.

skills.name: DIRECTIVE: Drill
skills.Description: Launch a series of seed bullets into the sky, raining down for 450% damage per second.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via the REX: Bushwhacked Challenge. (As REX, complete an entire teleporter event while under 50% health.)
Hits 16 times for 90% damage per hit, dealing a total of 1440% damage over a 3 second period.

skills.name: Seed Barrage
skills.Description: 15% HP. Launch a mortar into the sky for 450% damage.

skills.name: DIRECTIVE: Disperse
skills.Description:
Fire a 
Sonic Boom
 that 
Weakens
 all enemies hit.
skills.Notes:
The knockback from the skill varies depending on the size of the target; larger enemies are pushed less than small ones.
When used in the air, this skill knocks REX back towards the camera a significant amount.

skills.name: Bramble Volley
skills.Description:
20% HP. Fire a 
Sonic Boom
 that damages enemies for 550% damage. Heals for every target hit.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via the REX: Dunked Challenge. (As REX, kill a Clay Dunestrider on Abandoned Aqueduct by throwing it into a pit.)
Heals REX for 10% of their max HP per target hit.
The knockback from the skill varies depending on the size of the target; larger enemies are pushed less than small ones.
Also pushes REX back while in the air.

skills.name: DIRECTIVE: Harvest
skills.Description: Fire a bolt that deals 330% damage and injects an enemy. On death, drop multiple healing fruits that heal for 25% HP.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via the REX: Full of Life Challenge. (As REX, heal for 1000 health at once.)
Inflicts the 
 Fruiting
 debuff, which lasts 10 seconds.
The attack has a slight area of effect, so multiple enemies can be inflicted with Fruiting at once if they are close together.
When a Fruiting enemy is killed, it drops 2-8 fruits (scaling with the enemy's max HP) that last 20 seconds.

skills.name: Tangling Growth
skills.Description: 25% HP. Fire a flower that roots for 200% damage. Heals for every target hit.
skills.Notes:
The flower requires 1 second to unfurl after hitting terrain or an enemy, then remains active for 8 seconds.
The flower's area of effect is indicated by a green ring around itself. When an enemy enters the ring, it becomes 
 entangled
 and is pulled towards the flower.
Heals REX for an estimated 1.5% of their max HP every second per snared target.
Even after an entangled enemy is killed, it will continue to heal REX until the flower expires.
The flower can deal a total of 400% damage, 200%, on impact, and 200% on pull.

Railgunner.description: The Railgunner is a long-range, single target survivor that can instantly kill any high priority target - and from any range.

stats.Health Regen:
1.5/s (+0.3 per level)
 1/s (+0.2 per level)
 0.6/s (+0.12 per level)

Railgunner.name: Railgunner

skills.name: Magnetic Accelerator
skills.Description: All Critical Strike Chance is converted into Critical Strike Damage.
skills.Notes:
Unlike other Survivors, Railgunner cannot get random critical strikes. Instead, she is guaranteed to get critical strikes when hitting enemies' exposed weak points, and her critical strike chance increases the amount of damage her critical strikes deal.
Each 1% of critical strike chance becomes 1% bonus critical strike damage. The base critical strike damage is 200%, i.e., double damage, and can be further increased by 
Laser Scope
. Therefore, Railgunner having 50% critical strike chance means a critical hit will deal 250% damage instead of the usual 200%.

skills.name: XQR Smart Round System
skills.Description: Fire aggressive tracking rounds for 100% damage.
skills.Notes:
Fires 4 times per second at base attack speed.
The skill does not become inactive without targets nearby, unlike 
 Huntress's
 
 Strafe
, 
 Flurry
, and 
 Laser Glaive
.
While the attack shoots out forwards, it may home in on enemies that Railgunner is not looking at.
The shots have slight recoil, enough to disable the effects of 
Bustling Fungus
.

skills.name: M99 Sniper
skills.Description: Activate your long-range scope, highlighting Weak Points and transforming your weapon into a piercing 1000% damage railgun.
skills.Notes:
Replaces Railgunner's primary with 
 M99
.
Scoping in takes 7 frames (0.116 seconds), after which Railgunner's primary skill becomes M99. A visual decoration expands for 6 frames afterwards. Pressing the primary button during the 7-frame scope-in results in a shot from Railgunner's unscoped primary, not an M99 shot.
After taking a scoped shot and unscoping, Railgunner's primary skill becomes 
 Active Reload
 until her rifle is reloaded. While reloading, Railgunner cannot activate M99 Sniper again.
Unscoping takes 14 frames (0.233 seconds) when the key is released, and the reload indicator does not appear until fully unscoped.
Pressing the secondary button during this 14-frame window will immediately scope back in, although Railgunner must still reload once the 14 frames are up. However, this allows her to scope back in while reloading, enabling faster shots overall. If the player misses this 14-frame window, they cannot scope in again until reloaded.
At default attack speed, the cursor reaches the perfect reload zone 30 frames (0.5 seconds) after the reload indicator appears, allowing for a default minimum time between shots of 0.733 seconds (about 1.36 shots per second) assuming perfect inputs of both unscoping and reloading, and rescoping before fully unscoped.
With perfect inputs rescoping only after reloading, the default minimum time between shots is 0.849 seconds (about 1.17 shots per second).
Having any 
Backup Magazines
 allows Railgunner to take multiple consecutive shots (1 per second at base attack speed) before having to reload. All charges reload at once.
However, only the first shot taken after a perfect reload receives the bonus.

skills.name: M99
skills.Description: Launch a heavy projectile for 1000% damage.
skills.Notes:
This skill is only available when holding down 
 M99 Sniper
, while the reload bar is not active.
If the player immediately rescopes after unscoping, and fails the perfect reload, M99 will not reload charges.

skills.name: Active Reload
skills.Description: Perfectly time your reload to recover faster and to boost the damage of your next shot by +100%.
skills.Notes:
Correction: a perfect reload increases the next ability's damage by +500%, not +100%
This skill is only available after firing 
 M99
.
Approximately 0.28 seconds after releasing the secondary skill (unscoping), this skill temporarily replaces Railgunner's primary.
While this skill is available, the player cannot activate 
 M99 Sniper
.
After unscoping, a reload bar appears with a cursor that moves from left to right and a colored "perfect reload" zone. Pressing the button while the cursor is in the perfect reload zone not only allows Railgunner to fire again faster, but the next 
 M99
, 
 Supercharge
 or 
 Cryocharge
 attack deals an extra 500% base damage.
Unscoped Primary Fire does not apply or expend the bonus damage buff.
The damage bonus is indicated by a red lightning icon in the top-left corner of Railgunner's HUD.
Failing a perfect reload prevents Railgunner from firing again until the cursor has moved all the way across and reaches the end. At default attack speed, this takes exactly 2 seconds from the moment the reload indicator appears.
The perfect reload zone becomes wider with increased attack speed, making perfect reloads easier.
The bonus damage buff is lost when firing 
 M99
, even if the shot does not hit any targets.

skills.name: HH44 Marksman
skills.Description: Activate your short-range scope, highlighting Weak Points and transforming your weapon into a quick 400% damage railgun.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via the Railgunner: Marksman Challenge. (As Railgunner, fire 30 consecutive sniper shots without missing a Weak Point.)
Replaces Railgunner's primary with 
 HH44
.
Scoping in takes 6 frames (0.1 seconds), after which Railgunner's primary skill becomes HH44. Pressing the primary button during the 6-frame scope-in results in a shot from Railgunner's unscoped primary, not an HH44 shot.
Scoping in takes 6 frames (0.1 seconds). Railgunner's Primary skill is replaced with HH44 at the end of this duration.
Unscoping takes 30 frames (0.5 seconds), but H44 is replaced with Railgunner's normal primary immediately upon releasing the key.

skills.name: HH44
skills.Description: Launch a light projectile for 400% damage.
skills.Notes:
This skill is only available when holding down 
 HH44 Marksman
.
HH44 fires 2 times per second at base attack speed.
Railgunner does not need to reload between shots while using HH44. While this does lower the downtime between shots, this also means she cannot benefit from perfect reloads or Backup Magazines.
Unlike M99, HH44 fires automatically as long as the primary key is held.
This allows for a near-instant shot immediately upon activating HH44 Marksman's scope.

skills.name: Concussion Device
skills.Description: Throw out a device that pushes you and all nearby enemies away. Can hold up to 2.
skills.Notes:
Agile
.
Unlike 
 Acrid's
 
 Caustic Leap
 and 
 Frenzied Leap
, this skill does not give fall damage immunity during its duration, so launching too high into the air can result in severe fall damage.
If another Concussion Device is thrown while another is active, the first one will immediately detonate.
Targets take no damage from the explosion itself, but if launched high enough or off a ledge, can take fall damage.
The force of the push is based on the target's current velocity plus some additional force. It is independent of distance from the device, though because the direction of the push is directly away from the device, airborne targets (including Railgunner herself) further away are generally pushed more level with the ground than if they are closer.
Because the force of the push is based on current velocity, jumping (adding vertical velocity) just before the device detonates results in a stronger push.

skills.name: Polar Field Device
skills.Description: Throw out a device that slows down all nearby enemies and projectiles.
skills.Notes:
Agile
.
Unlocked via the Railgunner: Annihilator Challenge. (As Railgunner, deal 1,000,000 damage in one shot.)
The duration of the slowing field is also 12 seconds.

skills.name: Supercharge
skills.Description: Fire a piercing round for 4000% damage and 150% Weak Point damage. Afterwards, all your weapons are disabled for 5 seconds.
skills.Notes:
Correction: The disabled period is actually 6 seconds not 5.
Upon casting, after approximately 2 seconds at base attack speed, replaces Railgunner's primary with 
 Supercharged Railgun
.
The cooldown for this ability begins upon casting. Failing to fire in time will cause the cooldown to continue uninterrupted, but taking the shot puts it on full cooldown again. It will only begin to cool down once Railgunner's weapons come back online.
Increased attack speed reduces both the charge time and the duration that Railgunner's weapons are disabled after firing the shot.
If Railgunner has the 
Visions of Heresy
 and/or 
Hooks of Heresy
, neither 
 Hungering Gaze
 nor 
 Slicing Maelstrom
 are disabled after taking a Supercharge shot.

skills.name: Supercharged Railgun
skills.Description: Launch a super-charged projectile for 4000% damage. Critical Strike damage is multiplied by 1.5.
skills.Notes:
Description clarification: The extra Weak Point damage boosts the base damage by 50% when hitting weak points BEFORE the skill's and critical strike's damage multipliers apply.
This skill is only available after using 
 Supercharge
.
Requires a short preparation and has a brief delay between pressing the primary button and firing. Additionally, all primary, secondary, and special skills are disabled for 5 seconds. Utility skills and skills gained from Heresy items are not disabled.
The shot is only available to fire for about 3 seconds. Failing to fire it in time will not disable Railgunner's guns.

skills.name: Cryocharge
skills.Description:
Freezing
. Fire a piercing round for 2000% damage.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via the Railgunner: Trickshot Challenge. (As Railgunner, get 3 kills with a single Supercharge shot while airborne.)
Upon casting, after approximately 2 seconds at base attack speed, replaces Railgunner's primary with 
 Cryocharged Railgun
.

skills.name: Cryocharged Railgun
skills.Description: Freezing. Launch a super-cooled projectile for 350% damage.
skills.Notes:
Correction: the skill deals 2000% damage, not 350%.
This skill is only available after using 
 Cryocharge
.
Requires a short preparation and has a brief delay between pressing the primary button and firing. Unlike Supercharged Railgun, skills are not disabled.
Enemies brought to or below their execution threshold will not be executed by that shot, requiring a second shot to be executed.
After using this skill, Railgunner can fire immediately afterwards with M99 without having to reload inbetween.

Seeker.description: As a meditative mid-range brawler, Seeker utilizes powerful healing to sustain herself and her team.

stats.Health Regen:
1.125/s (+0.225 per level)
 0.75/s (+0.15 per level)
 0.45/s (+0.09 per level)

Seeker.name: Seeker

skills.name: Inner Strength
skills.Description: Abilities are enhanced with each Tranquility to a maximum of 7.
skills.Notes:
Tranquility
 stacks are obtained by successfully completing the Quick Time Event when using Meditate or by successfully hitting three entities with a single Palm Blast .
Only 6 stacks of Tranquility can be obtained. The 7th grants 
 Saving Grace
, which does not directly enhance Seeker's skills; however, it boosts all stats by 7% and therefore indirectly buffs her attacks. 
 Saving Grace
 will automatically 
Revive
 Seeker once per stage, so long as she has reached 7th Tranquility prior to her death.

skills.name: Spirit Punch
skills.Description: Fire piercing disembodied fists at enemies for 250% damage. Every 3rd hit explodes dealing 350% damage.
skills.Notes:
Every hit 
 slows
 the target.
The third hit gains 50% more damage for each stack of 
 Tranquility
, making it 600% at 6 stacks.
The first two hits go through terrain, allowing her to hit enemies from behind cover.
Each shot has an effective range of 54m before expiring. The final hit explodes in a 7m radius with no falloff regardless of whether it has collided with an enemy, so it can still damage nearby monsters.

skills.name: Unseen Hand
skills.Description: Stunning. Launch a piercing phantasmal hand from the ground, dealing 600% damage. Heals for 3.5% of the damage dealt.
skills.Notes:
Stunning
.
Heals for 3.5% of damage dealt per enemy hit and an additional 4% per 
 Tranquility
 stack, maxing out at 27.5% at 6 stacks.

skills.name: Soul Spiral
skills.Description: Manifest spiraling orbs dealing 150% damage. Hits grant temporary barrier. Exhilarate on activation at max orbs.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via Seeker: Airborne Souls (As Seeker, hit three or more airborne enemies with a single use of the exploding third hit of Spirit Punch.)
Each orb can hit 11 times before expiring, with the final hit dealing 200% damage.
Each stack of 
 Tranquility
 grants two more hits per orb before expiring, capping out at 23 hits.
Each orb grants 3% barrier on hit.
Each stack of 
 Tranquility
 grants 1% more barrier, capping out at 9% barrier on hit.
Up to 6 orbs can be cast at a time. Casting after reaching max stacks will spin the orbs.
At max spin speed, the orbs deal up to +50% damage.
Ease in: 0.5s, Boost: 3s, Ease out: 1.0s

skills.name: Sojourn
skills.Description:
Stunning
. Take flight and explode, dealing 500% damage. Exchange 25% health per second for increased damage.
skills.Notes:
Stunning
.
After a grace period of 1.8 seconds, Seeker takes 5% of her max health as damage every 0.2 seconds. This is further decreased by her natural armor and any other damage-reduction method, particularly 
Repulsion Armor Plate
. This can make Sojourn flight much safer in a similar way to reducing the self-damaging effects of 
Helfire Tincture
.
The damage is dealt relative to Seeker's Base HP + Level HP, ignoring shields, barrier, or any other health-increasing items.
If Seeker ever drops below 15% of max health after the grace period, she will immediately exit Sojourn.
After the grace period, the blast damage increases by 500% every second.
The blast radius initially starts at 5m and grows hyperbolically towards 20m. Both of these values are increased by 0.5m and 1.5m respectively for each 
 Tranquility
 stack. The final blast radius is 110% of what the previous value is at that moment in time when Seeker exits the mode.
After the grace period, every second of flight cuts your healing by 10% until 10 seconds of flight, at which point you receive 0% healing from all sources. The game will always round it to 1, but no health is actually gained. This means that after a certain point, items that reduce, mitigate, or otherwise negate damage will be the only viable methods of extending Sojourn.
While in Sojourn, you can not activate your equipment under any circumstances (even if Seeker has a 
Gesture of the Drowned
 in her inventory).
Sojourn can end prematurely if the player collides with any terrain.
While in Sojourn, you are 
 immune to damage
 from most damages, even including the Void Fog and the implosion effects of 
 
 
 
 Void monsters.
Two notable exceptions to this is 
Delayed Damage
 and the Voidling's Nullifier Black Hole.
Unlike Mercenary's 
 Hidden Invincibility
, this immunity also includes Interactables that cost health, such as Shrine of Blood, Void Cradle and Void Potential.
Similar to most mobility skills, when using Sojourn, Seeker is considered to be 'sprinting', this creates some strong synergies with certain sprint based items.
Rose Buckler
 will reduce some of the self-inflicted damage due to the armor it grants.
Little Disciple
 can still fire tracking wisps throughout the duration of the ability.
Sojourn has a strong synergy with 
Razorwire
 due to the rapidly inflicted self-damage.
This is further enhanced when using the alternate secondary skill, Soul Spiral, allowing Seeker to prolong the duration of Sojourn due to the barrier provided on each orb hit.

skills.name: Reprieve
skills.Description: Gain barrier and take flight. Total barrier loss or impact creates a cyclone, healing allies, and dealing 200% damage per second.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via Seeker: Scorched Earth (Deal 500,000% damage with one use of Sojourn's explosion.)
The vortex pulls in monsters in a 15m radius. (1/2 of Primordial_Cube)
the vortex deal 200% damage/s thus 800 damage total with 4s.
with the max 6 stack of 
 Tranquility
 the total damage are 1400%.
Each stack of 
 Tranquility
 increase the duration of the vortex for 0.5s each, capping out at 7s.

skills.name: Meditate
skills.Description: Focus your mind to explode 300% damage, heal nearby allies, and gain Tranquility. Reaching max Tranquility Revives and grants Saving Grace.
skills.Notes:
The player gets 5 seconds to correctly input 5 keys. Failing an input decreases the available time by 1s and failing the entire sequence causes the skill to be put on an additional 5s cooldown, regardless of any cooldown reductions.
Upon activation, the player is suspended in air (pausing all motion) and granted 25% of max health as barrier (not counting any shields). If the max health is lower than 115, Seeker's base health, it is set to that instead. The max health value used will be referred to as healingValue.
When the inputs have been successfully completed, any allies in a 12m radius are healed by 4% of healingValue. This is increased by 4% for each additional 
 Tranquility
 stack, for a maximum of 32% at 6 stacks.
Upon completion, monsters within a 12m radius are also hit for 450% base damage. This is increased by 200% for each additional 
 Tranquility
 stack, for a maximum of 1650% at 6 stacks.
Upon any successful completion of Meditate after 7 stacks of 
 Tranquility
 have been reached, any dead players are Revived, while any living ones are granted 
 Saving Grace
, which boosts all stats by 7%.
Once this effect has been used on each player, it cannot be used again until Seeker completes the process anew on a subsequent stage.
Each player can be revived via this method once per stage.
A player's ability to be revived is independent of other players.
The color of the petals in the UI at the bottom right of the screen are a shade of transparent gold for each Tranquility level attained. Once the 7th Tranquility has been obtained and the power to Revive allies and bless them with Saving Grace has been reached, a green flash of energy in the shape of blooming Lotus Blossom petals bursts forth from Seeker. Seeker can be revived by her passive ability after this point, and any subsequent use of Meditate will Revive dead allies who are eligible for Revive.
If Seeker is revived, she retains any Tranquility stacks she had prior to death. This allows her to completely negate a team wipe by passively reviving herself, then using Meditate to respawn the entire team.

skills.name: Palm Blast
skills.Description: Charge a piercing, spectral hand that deals 400%-700% damage and heals allies. Multihit three characters to gain Tranquility and barrier.
skills.Notes:
Unlocked via Seeker: Clear Mind (As Seeker, meditate 20 times without missing an input in a single run.)
Charge for 1.5s to upgrade damage from 400% to 700% and change the color from green to yellow.
Each stack of 
 Tranquility
 increase size of the hand by 15% each and damages by 250%, capping out at 90% size and 1500% damage bonus to a total of 2200% if fully charged.
every 3 enemies hit with one palm blast give a stack of 
 Tranquility

Void Fiend.description: The Void Fiend is a corrupted survivor that fluctuates between a controlled and corrupted form, each with different strengths and weaknesses. Managing this curse has become its fate.

stats.Health Regen:
1.5/s (+0.3 per level)
 1/s (+0.2 per level)
 0.6/s (+0.12 per level)

Void Fiend.name: Void Fiend

skills.name: Void Corruption
skills.Description: At full Corruption, transform your abilities into more aggressive forms.
skills.Notes:
Stylized in-game as V??oid Co??rruption.
The Void Fiend's Corruption is visible as a circular gauge, ranging from 0-100%.
The 
 Void Survivor Corruption
 buff indicates when the Void Fiend is in its corrupted state and grants 100 armor.
While the Void Fiend is uncorrupted, the Corruption gauge fills over time. While it is corrupted, the inverse is true, and Corruption depletes over time.
Taking damage, landing critical strikes, and possessing void items builds Corruption, while healing will reduce Corruption.
For each void item the Void Fiend possesses, its minimum Corruption level is increased by 2%. This makes it corrupt itself faster, but does not make its corrupted duration shorter. Instead, the corruption depletes at a slower rate the more void items it possesses.
Minimum Corruption can be increased to 100%, which permanently locks the Void Fiend into its corrupted state.
Increasing it beyond 100% results in it flickering between the minimum value and 100% with no effect on gameplay.
Corruption is reset to minimum upon advancing to the next stage.
Receiving any healing reduces corruption percentage in either state. With enough passive healing through items its possible to avoid being corrupted without using Suppress, or simply be unable to be corrupted without instantly returning to a normal state.
When transforming, the Void Fiend gets 0.5 seconds of invincibility and the cooldowns of its abilities are reset.

skills.name: Drown
skills.Description: Fire a slowing long-range beam for 300% damage.
skills.Notes:
Stylized in-game as D??row?n.
Inflicts 
 50% Slow
.
Has infinite range.
Has a slight amount of aim assist, even when using keyboard and mouse.
Fires at a rate of 1.6(repeating) or 5/3 times per second by default.

skills.name: Corrupted Drown
skills.Description: Fire a short-range beam for 2000% damage.
skills.Notes:
Description clarification: Fires a laser that ticks approximately 8 times per second for 250% of Void Fiend's damage per shot, totaling to 2000% damage per second.
Increasing Void Fiend's attack speed increases the number of ticks per second.
Has no aim assist, unlike the uncorrupted version.
Pierces through enemies and terrain with a range of 40m.
Fires continuously while the button is held down.
Self-inflicts 
 50% Slow
 while in use.

skills.name: Flood
skills.Description: Fire a plasma missile for 600% damage. Fully charge it for an explosive plasma ball instead, dealing 1100% damage.
skills.Notes:
Stylized in-game as Floo?d.
Can sprint while charging (start charging and then sprint, needs to be repeated for every attack).
Takes about 1s to charge at base attack speed.
A fully charged Flood can be held indefinitely, and Flood's cooldown begins once it has been fully charged.
Pushes Void Fiend and enemies back when launched, pushing it further with a greater charge or while airborne.

skills.name: Corrupted Flood
skills.Description: Fire a an arcing plasma bomb for 1100% damage.
skills.Notes:
Unlike the uncorrupted version, it does not need to be charged at all and fires immediately.
Pushes Void Fiend back, but does not push enemies back.
Unlike the uncorrupted version, the projectile is affected by gravity and arcs downward over long distances.

skills.name: Trespass
skills.Description: Disappear into the Void, cleansing all debuffs while moving in an upward arc.
skills.Notes:
Stylized in-game as ?Tr?espass.
Can be used while channeling Suppress.
Neither the invulnerability or the movement can be cancelled early, except by transforming into its corrupted form.
Leaves the Void Fiend with some upward momentum when exiting the skill.
The distance traveled and ending momentum scale with movement speed.
The invulnerability completely removes Void Fiend's hitbox.

skills.name: Corrupted Trespass
skills.Description: Disappear into the Void, cleansing all debuffs while moving at a fast forward angle.
skills.Notes:
Has a shorter duration than the uncorrupted version, giving a narrower window of invincibility.
The distance traveled and ending momentum scales with movement speed.
Similar to 
 Phase Blink
, Corrupted Trespass moves the Void Fiend horizontally but not vertically.

skills.name: Suppress
skills.Description: Crush 25% Corruption to heal yourself for 25% maximum health.
skills.Notes:
Agile
.
Stylized in-game as Sup??ress.
Takes about 1s to channel at base attack speed.
If Corruption reaches 100% while channeling, the Void Fiend stops channeling and transforms into its corrupted form.
If Void Fiend's minimum Corruption from gathering void items is 25% or higher, this can be used infinitely.

skills.name: Corrupted Suppress
skills.Description: Crush 25% maximum health to gain 25% Corruption.
skills.Notes:
Agile
.
Has 2 base charges.
Charges are not restored until the Void Fiend becomes uncorrupted and then becomes corrupted once more.
Unaffected by cooldown-resetting effects such as the 
Bandolier
.
